name: Mixed Dal
history: Mixed Dal is a staple in Indian cuisine, combining various types of lentils to create a nutritious and flavorful dish. Each region in India has its own version of this dish, reflecting the diversity of Indian culinary traditions.
description: Mixed Dal is a hearty and healthy Indian dish made from a combination of different lentils, such as toor dal, moong dal, chana dal, and masoor dal. Cooked with spices and herbs, it is both comforting and satisfying.

instructions.title: Cook the Lentils
instructions.description: Rinse and soak the lentils for 30 minutes. Drain and cook the lentils with turmeric powder and sufficient water until tender.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tadka
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. SautÃ© until fragrant. Add onions and cook until translucent. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.

instructions.title: Add Spices
instructions.description: Add garam masala, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Cook the spices for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Combine with Cooked Lentils
instructions.description: Add the cooked lentils to the pan. Add salt and water to adjust consistency. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Soaking the lentils reduces cooking time and makes them easier to digest.
Adjust the heat by increasing or decreasing the amount of green chilies and red chili powder.
variations: Add vegetables like spinach or tomatoes for a nutritious twist.
For a smoky flavor, perform a final tempering (tadka) with ghee and red chili.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Pair with a side of pickled vegetables or a cooling raita.
